headline.main: What’s on TV Monday: The First Presidential Debate

docs.snippet: Half of America's likely voters will rely on the presidential debates to help them make their choice between Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Hillary Clinton in the Nov. 8 election, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Half of America's likely voters will rely on the presidential debates to help them make their choice between Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Hillary Clinton in the Nov. 8 election, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Monday.

headline.main: Debates to Help Half of U.S. Voters Decide Between Clinton, Trump: Poll

docs.snippet: A longtime defender of fossil fuels and critic of regulations limiting greenhouse gases appears to be Trump’s pick to handle the transition at the Environmental Protection Agency should he prevail....

headline.main: No Debate: Trump Picks a Perfect Transition Man for the E.P.A.

docs.snippet: Asian shares began the week under a cloud on Monday after losses on Wall Street, as investors' attention turned from central banks to American politics ahead of the first U.S. presidential debate....

docs.snippet: Dozens of former appointees of the administration of former President George W. Bush announced their support for Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump on Sunday in a bid for party unity ahead of Trump's first debate with Democrat Hillary Cl...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dozens of former appointees of the administration of former President George W. Bush announced their support for Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump on Sunday in a bid for party unity ahead of Trump's first debate with Democrat Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Ahead of Debate, Trump Endorsed by Some Bush Alumni

docs.snippet: Democrat Hillary Clinton has pulled ahead of Republican rival Donald Trump in the traditional battleground state of Florida, strengthening her position in the race for the White House, the Reuters/Ipsos States of the Nation project showed ahead of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Democrat Hillary Clinton has pulled ahead of Republican rival Donald Trump in the traditional battleground state of Florida, strengthening her position in the race for the White House, the Reuters/Ipsos States of the Nation project showed ahead of the pair's first presidential debate on Monday night.

headline.main: Reuters/Ipsos States of the Nation: Clinton Leads in Florida
headline.print_headline: Reuters/Ipsos States of the Nation: Clinton Leads in Florida

headline.main: Presidential Debate, Aleppo, Arnold Palmer: Your Monday Briefing

docs.snippet: With a tightly controlled state media, little access to outside information and a deeply instilled belief that whoever runs the White House is bound to be their sworn enemy, North Koreans aren't expecting much from the U.S. presidential elections ...
docs.lead_paragraph: With a tightly controlled state media, little access to outside information and a deeply instilled belief that whoever runs the White House is bound to be their sworn enemy, North Koreans aren't expecting much from the U.S. presidential elections — if they know about them at all.

headline.main: Donald Who? Most N. Koreans Don't Know, Care About US Polls
headline.print_headline: Donald Who? Most N. Koreans Don't Know, Care About US Polls
